body: I take B vitamins all the time. I would always notice that I would have super deep yellow urine after I take them. And you know what that means? The vitamins are going straight through your body and are not being absorbed. I thought, as long as some of it is absorbed, then I am okay... So, I continued to take these B-vitamins from all sorts of brands that I would find at Target or CVS. Until one day, I was watching random videos on youtube on my phone and I accidentally clicked something and a video talking about B-Vitamins comes on. I was driving, so I just left it on as I listened. In this video, I learned that B-12 vitamins come in 3 forms. The most common form is cyanocobalamin, which most cheap B vitamins and multi-vitamins have. This is the form of B-12 that makes your piss turn deep yellow, because your body absorbs so little of it. Then they go on to explain that Methylcobalamin is the most effective form of B-12 that you can digest. This form actually is absorbed by your body. I forget what the 3rd form was.
title: Methyl > Cyan All Day!

body: Just switched to this Vegan product from VegLife Vegan B-12. Unfortunately both products seem to leave me with a light headache after I dissolve them in the mouth which is the recommended way to take them. I have had similar headaches before when drinking juices that contain added Citric acid so I am thinking it may be the Citric and Stearic acids in these products that are causing the headache ... This product also has Xylitol, a natural sweetener some people have sensitivity to. I do need to get my B-12 level up so short of not finding an alternative Vegan B-12 product that does not have these acids I am having to take this product but swallowing it (rather than dissolving in mouth) with plenty of liquids while eating a meal which seems to reduce the headache somehow. body: I love that this B12 supplement is the methylcobalamin form. The quantity of 5000 mcg is really to much to take on a daily basis unless you have an extreme B12 deficiency. If you don't have a B12 deficiency, most of the supplement is literally flushed from your system. Through my research I have learned that once your B12 is to an acceptable level, taking a B-complex supplement will maintain it. In addition, your age should be considered. As we get older, we don metabolize B12 as well as we used to. So an additional B12 supplement may be necessary. For my 96 year old mother and I, I have been using a B-Complex supplement, and we take this one once a week to keep our levels up. So far this has been working for us.

body: I have multiple medical conditions, including B-12 deficiency, poor absorption issues, and severe hypothyroidism. A few years ago, I began having "shooting pain" that felt like gasoline/electrical surges in my arms and legs. No matter what medications I took, nothing helped and the pain intensified. I was told that I was close to B-12 deficiency, yet all the supplements that I tried didn't work. Finally I found Jarrow Methyl B-12 after reading on line where it was a potential aid for my condition. Since then I have taken it religiously. I have reported to my doctor that without it, I believe my health would have rapidly worsened. The pain is gone and I feel 100% better now that I am taking Methyl B-12 from Jarrow. I don't know if it will help anyone else as much as it has improved my health. I would recommend discussing it with your doctor or health care provider if you believe that you may be lacking or close to lacking in B-12. I love this product. For me, it has been a life-enhancer without equal. Thank you.

body: I was taking a 30 day supply of Nature's Bounty Methylcobalamin Vitamin B-12 1000 mcg and had the best results with a sublingual supplement in my 5 yrs of dealing with a B-12 deficiency. I had the same results with Nature's Bounty as other reviewers claimed to have with this brand (noticeable improvement in concentration, short term memory esp with numbers, energy level with more restful sleep, and the complete elimination of chronic low grade depression), so I figured I try Jarrow since I had trouble finding Nature's Bounty at my local pharmacies. Big mistake. This was like taking a regular B-12 supplement with none of the above results from the other brand. First off, this isn't a true sublingual; it's way too big to stick under your tongue and is not a quick dissolve like most sublingual pills are, which is probably why it doesn't work so well. I'm going to try a different brand and will not repurchase this brand again. Hope that helps someone else from wasting money on this.
title: Not a true sublingual

body: I was having some problems with lethargy and hair loss, so I decided to take B-12 supplements (blood work revealed just over the low limit of the range, ~212 pg).  Reviews on Amazon/research told me that liquid/lozenge form was the way to go - that absorption is limited via pill.  I first tried a highly rated methylcobalamin liquid formula that worked pretty well, but I was still tired and had a little bit of hair loss.  I switched to this product and it works really, really well!  Hair loss has stopped and while I'm not bouncing off the walls, I don't yawn all day long/come home and crawl into bed.  I need to have blood work done again to see what my new levels are (they may still be low and I may have an overall absorption issue), but I have definitely noticed a difference!
title: Love, love, love it

body: And oddly enough, I sleep better on the days I remember to supplement with this product. I tend to have nights of insomnia, but noticed that it never seems to happen when I take this particular B. I also take another B supplement that has other types of B12 in it, but that also has a lot of other things that tend to keep me awake if I take it too late in the day. I like having B12 I can take when I forget the other. I had pernicious anemia so seriously 11 years ago I was on daily injections for almost a year. Must take a sublingual. Also, my daughter and husband who both have celiac disease MUST supplement with B12 and it makes a difference in their energy levels. B12 is absorbed in the area of the small intestine that is destroyed by gluten, so anyone with celiac disease must take the various forms of 12 (there are four--this is the most absorbable and most important one to take if you chose just one--most companies use the cheapest one in formulas but it's not very absorbable, especially in the gut-- I can't remember the exact name--).

I still recommend this product, but be careful if you are not already taking 5000 mg dosage.  Take only a 1/4 or 1/2 a pill.

body: So I work nightshift and if anyone ever has before, you know how much it can wear on your body. I haven't been sleeping as well lately, have had trouble staying up at work, have trouble thinking and horrible brain fog, been down in the dumps, haven't had energy, started having a "lead weight" feeling all over my body, started hating my job and disliking people in general. Well, I knew something needed to change so I hit the internet and came across these. Before even knowing that it would help with brain fog I noticed on my own that I could think clearer! And now, after taking them for 2-3 weeks I have noticed a huge difference in my mood. I am happier, I have more enegry, and I can tolerate things better. I am able to get through a night now without nodding off! I notice I don't have to sleep all day anymore after working a night, and I have been able to work better on 6-7 hours of sleep. Whereas before, I could sleep for 10 hours and still be tired and then take a nap after that! I still have the lead weight feeling, but it isn't as bad as it used to be. Nightshift is hard on the body, and this has definitely helped a lot. I think if I were on a normal schedule, they would help with my brain fog even more! Also, I am taking 2 a day for a month and will decrease the dose when I think my body has a sufficient amount. I don't think they taste bad at all but they do take awhile to dissolve. I will also quit taking them for a week at one point to see how my mood is and to see if it is actually these that are helping or just pure coincidence. I will update when I do so.

body: These seem to work better than the regular B-12 sublinguals I've been getting from Walmart forever.  As well, I have been taking B-100 which has B12 in it also for years.  Before taking this Methyl B-12 I had blood work done for B12 for many other health issues I'm trying to resolve. I had that day taken the regular B12, which I informed them of, and it is like a 2500 dose, so of course my blood levels of B12 were high. They do not test specifically as far as I can tell.  BUT, what I have only just now begun to notice. after taking This methyl B12 for the first time, is that the white moons at the nail bed base are starting to form on my thumbs................AND other fingernails!  I find this totally amazing...... I've had issues with energy since I was a kid and started taking B12 shots in my teens then off and on for Years since then; as well taken the B-Complete suppliments and B12 sublinguals -including the liquid sublinguals- for Many years.... and I have NEVER had the moons on my other fingernail beds.... I even thought that they were Only supposed to be on the thumbs and little to none showing was Normal. Now I have read what the moons mean as far as health and vitamin enrichment/presence in the body, so this is relative to me.  I've Never ever had the moons on other fingernail beds, and the thumb ones were always very small and not very contrasting.  NOW, they are growing larger, much larger, and also in bright contrast to the rest of the nail, and Again, are starting to show in the other nailbeds as well! I have read that there's an inherited link with regards to b12 deficiency, so best to cover your bases! It's a safe water soluble vitamin that causes NO harm. If you suffer from fatigue, cognitive problems, trembling, balance problems, painful tingling and numbness in your hands and or feet I  would first suggest you have your levels checked by your Dr. Otherwise, these are a great alternative to injections...or you can use inbetween your injections. If you're looking at this product, you must be curious about the benefit or need for...there's a wonderful book written by Sally Patcholok called 'Could it be b12?' it was a lifesaver for me. body: These seem to work better than the regular B-12 sublinguals I've been getting from Walmart forever.  As well, I have been taking B-100 which has B12 in it also for years. I had that day taken the regular B12, which I informed them of, and it is like a 2500 dose, so of course my blood levels of B12 were high. They do not test specifically as far as I can tell.  BUT, what I have only just now begun to notice. after taking This methyl B12 for the first time, is that the white moons at the nail bed base are starting to form on my thumbs................AND other fingernails!  I find this totally amazing...... I've had issues with energy since I was a kid and started taking B12 shots in my teens then off and on for Years since then; as well taken the B-Complete suppliments and B12 sublinguals -including the liquid sublinguals- for Many years.... and I have NEVER had the moons on my other fingernail beds.... I even thought that they were Only supposed to be on the thumbs and little to none showing was Normal. Now I have read what the moons mean as far as health and vitamin enrichment/presence in the body, so this is relative to me.  I've Never ever had the moons on other fingernail beds, and the thumb ones were always very small and not very contrasting.  NOW, they are growing larger, much larger, and also in bright contrast to the rest of the nail, and Again, are starting to show in the other nailbeds as well!  I find this happening to be the most tell-tell sign that this form of B12 is superior to the others that I have used for years, and that even show in my bloodwork, but never made this change.  Because of all the other health issues I suffer, I cannot say for sure about the energy levels and mental improvements that may occur using this. body: I suffer from pernicious anemia/b12deficiency for which I take injectable methylcobalamin for. These lozenges are great if you are not so deficient that you've gotten nerve damage. Sadly mine wasn't caught soon enough, hence the need for injectable form. I have ordered these twice for my Mom and my Son, they've both benefited greatly from them. I have read that there's an inherited link with regards to b12 deficiency, so best to cover your bases! It's a safe water soluble vitamin that causes NO harm. If you suffer from fatigue, cognitive problems, trembling, balance problems, painful tingling and numbness in your hands and or feet I  would first suggest you have your levels checked by your Dr. Otherwise, these are a great alternative to injections...or you can use inbetween your injections. If you're looking at this product, you must be curious about the benefit or need for...there's a wonderful book written by Sally Patcholok called 'Could it be b12?' it was a lifesaver for me. Just look at the reviews of the book, that says it all.
title: The best

body: This is a high potency B12, designed to be tucked under the tongue and allowed to dissolve.  If you swallow it whole, you won't get the full potency.  The taste is good (not true for all sublinguals) and it definitely got my blood levels of B12 up to where they needed to be.  Be warned, though, that taking high doses of B12 can hide deficiencies in folic acid and vitamin B6.  I started taking this dose after starting to take Deplin, and it works fine.  But be sure and get occasional blood tests to make sure your levels of all three are OK.

body: (1)Both products are extremely delicious and it's difficult to resist the temptation to eat too much.  (2)Both products contain 1000 micrograms of methylcobalamin per tablet and will easily and rapidly dissolve in our mouth.  (3)Both products are economically priced but the Jarrow Formulas product is 11.78% cheaper per tablet than the Source Naturals product.  (4)One white-colored Jarrow Formulas tablet (lozenge) is much, much larger than one pink-colored Source Naturals tablet.  (5)Jarrow Formulas other ingredients:  xylitol, cellulose, vegetable-source stearic acid, lemon flavor, vegetable-source magnesium stearate, citric acid, and silicon dioxide.  Suitable for vegetarians and vegans.  (6)Source Naturals other ingredients:  mannitol, sorbitol, natural cherry flavor, stearic acid, and magnesium stearate.

I have been using them for 4 years now. My condition has not worsened and seems to have improved, if not gone away. My father mentioned a similar problem and I offered him these vitamins. He saw improvement within a month. He offered them to an older brother. The brother did not see his pains go away but found substantial improvement in his memory. He now uses them as part of his everyday regimen, calling my dad whenever he is running low for a fresh supply. As neither of these men has a computer, I have become their supplier and find it rather amusing that they call, asking for their 'vitamin B fix'.

You will have to crush these pills a bit with your teeth before putting them under your tongue. Also, I didn't experience any significant increases in energy from these pills and it's already been about 2 weeks. It's probably best to go for vitamin B12 injections if energy is what you seek from taking this product. If you're looking to just repair damaged DNA then I presume this product is okay for that.

body: B-12 levels up nicely on my last blood draw. Formulation is the key to success with B-12. I like the taste which is important as B-12 in this formulation is best absorbed in the mouth and not once swallowed.

body: I am suffering from non-diabetic neuropathy as a result of bulging discs/canal stenosis in my lower back.  I have been living with the back pain for about 8 years.  Inversion table has helped a lot for the back but I am battling the resulting leg pain and inflammation.  I was hoping taking large doses of B12 might help the nerves in both my legs and back but after taking this for two months I had seen no improvement at all.  My GP told me it might take 3 months to see any impact.  I decided to switch to another brand (Wonder Labs) to see if that would make a difference.  I have been on that for close to another month and still no improvement.  My research had indicated this might help with nerve pain no matter the source but perhaps it is primarily for diabetic related pain or for those suffering from insufficient B12.  I have been eating a well rounded/healthy diet these last 2 years trying to improve my back situation so I don't believe I am low in B12.  I have another 3 or 4 months of B12 left so I will continue taking them with hopes it may just take longer.  I have also not felt any improvement in my energy.  The constant low grade pain seems to sap my energy and I was hoping to see a bit of a boost there.  Not to be.
title: Hopeful but disappointed

body: I really hate to post a negative review and don't normally post reviews at all, but I think I should start to as reading other's reviews has swayed my urge to buy or not. Well I just got this in the mail about 5 minutes ago, was on my doorstep. So I opened the package and the bottle felt really light. When I opened the bottle and looked in it I could tell it looked less than what's supposed to be in there, but I counted anyways and it came out to only 29 total lozenges, not 60. So I took one anyways just now and it had a slight pleasant flavor, but went away quickly after about a minute. Now it's just a tasteless thing under my tongue. The only other brand I have tried was from Walmart and that is the cyanocobalamin version, but at least that one stayed with the fruity taste until fully dissolved where as this one you have to chew it to break it up and then it dissolves a little. So I will not be buying this brand again, but I will try a different brand the other one I was contemplating before this one, which was the other brand of B12 Methylcobalamin 5000mcg Tablets you can get here on amazon, hopefully that one comes in the right amount and stays longer with the taste.
title: Only contained 29 total in the bottle.

body: I have ulcerative colitis, which prevents me from properly absorbing B12.  Last year I learned that my B12 was very low (136) and had injections to bring it up to 1100.  At the time I didn't realize I needed to continue taking B12, so I just stopped.  Within nine months it was back down to 214.  Not wanting to go through injection therapy again, I asked my doctor if I could try taking oral supplements.  He said I could try it but didn't have much confidence it would work.  I took these pills every day (one per day) for three months and was tested again - my level was at 1350!!!  I couldn't believe it and actually had them read it to me twice.  I plan to continue taking these on a permanent basis.  The cost of the injection therapy was approximately $800, so you can understand why I'm so thrilled that these work!
title: It works - I have the numbers to prove it.

body: I had heard that Jarrow had the best supplement products.  I shouldn't have assumed that the ingredients would be high quality, but they amazon didn't list them or show photos of the ingredients. I have a corn allergy, and I get an immediate headache, nausea, and breathing difficulties whenever I eat it. The first ingredient in the lozenges being Xylitol, I was immediately kicking myself after ingesting one and feeling the headache.  I ordered 300 ct. hoping they would last me a year, but I will have to return them. :C it isn't really Jarrow's fault that I am allergic to corn, but most supplements(vegan ones, at least) are free of allergens. I guess this purchase really caught me off guard.

body: After eating a vegan diet for 3 years, I started having serious problems with fatigue. A blood test revealed low B-12 levels. The doctor recommended monthly B-12 shots, but the bright red dye in the injections freaked me out (what IS that stuff?) and I didn't want the inconvenience of needing to go get shots, so I started taking the Jarrow Methyl B-12. My fatigue disappeared rapidly and my B-12 levels normalized. There is scientific research that shows B-12 absorption is not effected by whether you chew the tablets or dissolve them sublingually, so I chew them. Methyl B-12 is the best form to take as it is more bioavailable, and the more commonly found cyanocobalamin form of B-12 leaves trace amounts of cyanide in the body. Who needs that?! A highly regarded nutrition researcher and lecturer recommended the Jarrow brand to me and I'm very happy with the product.
title: Just chew them!

body: I have multiple medical conditions, including B-12 deficiency, poor absorption issues, and severe hypothyroidism. A few years ago, I began having "shooting pain" that felt like gasoline/electrical surges in my arms and legs. No matter what medications I took, nothing helped and the pain intensified. I was told that I was close to B-12 deficiency, yet all the supplements that I tried didn't work. Finally I found Jarrow Methyl B-12 after reading on line where it was a potential aid for my condition. Since then I have taken it religiously. I have reported to my doctor that without it, I believe my health would have rapidly worsened. The pain is gone and I feel 100% better now that I am taking Methyl B-12 from Jarrow. I don't know if it will help anyone else as much as it has improved my health. I would recommend discussing it with your doctor or health care provider if you believe that you may be lacking or close to lacking in B-12. I love this product. For me, it has been a life-enhancer without equal. Thank you.

body: I love this product! I've been reading about how the typical American diet leaves most people's body deficient in vitamin B-12. I'm not really interested in having B-12 injections so I was searching for an needle free alternative. I'm not a full blown vegetarian but I am working on reducing my consumption of meat  and animal products. However, since B-12 comes from animal sources, I know I needed a supplement. I read that B 12 protects nerve and brain cells from free radical damage, helps to reduce pain associated with neuropathy, supports the immune system, improves mood, and increases energy levels. However, not all B-12 supplements are created equal. Some contain Cyanocobalamin, which is a synthetic form of B 12, which makes it very cheap. The cyanide in this type of B-12 is not considered dangerous, but it does require the body to use energy to convert and remove it. Methylcobalamin is the most active form of B-12 and helps to protect the cardiovascular system as well as being able to cross the blood-brain barrier to protect the brain. This product is vegan friendly and contains methylcobalamin and adenosylcobalmin, the two most bioactive forms of B-12, so there is no need to worry about cyanide. Adenosylcobalmin is the least stable form of the 4 types of B-12 and it's hard to find it in supplements. It is naturally occurring and necessary for the Citric Acid cycle, which is the chemical reaction that happens in our bodies to generate energy from carbohydrates, fats and proteins. This product tastes good, with a nice sweet flavor to it. I take a dropperful every morning with a glass of water. I've noticed a slight increase in the overall feeling of well-being and a slight decrease in the discomfort I have from peripheral neuropathy. I would recommend this product to anyone.
title: I love this product

body: This is bar none THE best B12 that I have every taken. I have a genetic mutation (MTHFR) that prevents me from absorbing B12 through my food. Because of that, I have to get B12 injections weekly. I don't love injecting myself but it works. This product contains methylcobalamin and adenosylcobalamin, the two most bioactive forms of B12. Methylcobalamin is the most active form of B-12 and helps to protect the cardiovascular system as well as being able to cross the blood-brain barrier to protect the brain.  Great for someone like me or anyone suffering from B12 deficiency.
title: Best B12 ever!

body: I've only used this for about 3 weeks or so but I feel so much better taking it. I leave it on my bathroom counter & take it when I first get up in the morning. I had a B12 level done a few months ago and it was elevated. My doc said to quit taking my B12 so I did. I read in Medical Medium that the reason it's high is that the levels in the organs are low...in other words not being absorbed into the organs but instead circulating in the blood not doing a darned thing! This is the recommended product from the Medical Medium for those that are following his recommendations. I didn't know that when I first got it so I'm happy I got the one that seems to be working best for me!

Fortunately, I learned methyl only protects the organs while adeno protects nerves.  Interesting, first week I started taking it, felt tingling where I had gone numb from a surgery nearly 4 years ago.  Highly recommend.

I wish I had a diagnosis!). Initially I didn't think this was doing anything so after about two weeks I stopped taking it. A few days later my husband and I were both wondering what had changed that was making me worse--and I realized it coincided with my stopping this! I started up again and immediately started to feel better, and I do think the benefits build up for me over time (so I would give it 4 weeks to make a decision for yourself, which is conveniently one bottle).

body: I have been B-12 deficient for several years and my doctor has been trying to get me to come in for a weekly injection.  I have ignored his recommendation because I do not want to make an extra trip to his office every week, but more importantly, I DO NOT LIKE SHOTS.  I tried sublingual tablets for over a year and every 3 months my blood-work always came back the same; deficient.  I started taking VeganSafe B-12 after my last test 3 months ago, and finally last week my B-12 level was exactly where it should be!  Although this is an expensive solution at $1 per day, it is saving me a trip each week and the discomfort of a shot.  Until I can figure out another way to get more B-12 into my diet, this little bottle works perfectly for me.

body: I started taking this supplement in hopes that it would mitigate my anxiety and trouble focusing. body: I was on an anti-anxiety medication for over a decade and decided I didn't want to be a slave to it anymore. Anyone who has been on any kind of anti-depressant/anti-anxiety knows that it is very uncomfortable to go off. It takes a long time, and you feel very sick along the way. Taking B-12 during the weening process and even now has been a life saver. I can tell day and night weather I have taken my B-12 or not. I still have some situation anxiety but for the most part I feel great when I take it. I also take it with B6.
title: Anxiety Buster

body: got to say this works as reported, not so much that it energizes you but you feel better and have more stamina.  start some B12 and you wont need that mid afternoon snack or coffee for a boost to get thru the day.  i was quite surprised at how well i felt.  it makes a good difference.  however, if you are prone to sleeping problems, i suggest just taking half a pill. in the AM.  taking a whole pill, i found i was staying up past midnight as i just did not feel tired or sleepy causing me to sleep late the next morning.  when i changed to a half a pill my sleep pattern returned to normal that night.  im sold on taking B12.

body: I started using these drops after I had to have B12 injections after a nasty throat infection that left me run down and tired.  I didn't like having to get the B12 injections because they left a painful spot at the injection site, and I would get a surge after the injections that left me pretty wired for a day or two.  Since these drops can be taken on a regular basis (I've been using them 2-3 times a week), I feel I'm getting almost the exact same benefit as the more expensive and uncomfortable injections; I don't have to go to the dr. office and wait to be seen so not wasting my time.  The support from the seller was great; I emailed with a few questions and he got back to me immediately (like, within an hour).  I'm very, very pleased with this product and am telling several other friends and family members who would benefit from B12 drops to order these.  Very happy and will order again (and again...).

body: I started using the vitamin B12 liquid drops two days ago. I must say that I have seen a improvement on my energy levels especially during the afternoons. I followed one of the reviews I read on the intake of the liquid vitamins: " 5 drops the first day" since my item arrived after 1 pm. The next day: " 7 drops in the morning 6:30 am and 7 drops at noon." I am happy that I don't feel any crash.
title: Energy Levels Restored :)

body: Many people who have given this product negative reviews seem to have very unrealistic expectations of what a B12 supplement should do, which is probably because of the way this company markets it. It's a vitamin, not a shot of espresso – unless you're deficient in B12 this product is not going to make you feel any different. And unless a doctor has told you that you have a deficiency, or you're a vegan or vegetarian, you probably don't need a B12 supplement. If you're already absorbing adequate B12 from dietary sources like meat and dairy your body is just going to flush this out.
title: Good supplement, but don't expect too much

body: I have been taking very large doses of methylcobalamin for years in order to reduce numerous neurological issues and symptoms and help with my back pain (which is neurological in nature it appears, rather than structural) and have tried various brands and forms of sublinguals.  I have to say this is my favorite thus far.  It absorbs nicely, and I need less of it than I was using of the dots or tabs by other brands so it goes further.  The first time you use it the tingling under the tongue can feel intense, but that virtually went away by the 2nd dose.
title: I have to say this is my favorite thus far

body: I started going to a new doctor, and they wanted to do bloodwork after I told them I was vegan. I had been taking this product for a week or two before having my blood drawn. My B12 was flagged as out of range, but it was the opposite of my doctor's expectation. It was too high! There is nothing harmful about having high B12 levels, but certain conditions can cause your B12 levels to be higher than normal, so it's good to have it within range to avoid confusion. In light of this fact, I reduced my use of this supplement to once or twice a week. Since the body can store B12, it is not necessary to take it daily in my case. This has the added benefit of extending the life of the bottle.
title: Works very well as assessed by bloodwork

body: Wow! I am truly surprised by the efficiency of this product. I was using the sublingual  Vitamim B12 tablets and I did not notice any real difference. I read the reviews for this liquid Vitamin B12 supplement carefully before investing in this product. I started with 5 drops under my tongue the first day since I received my first shipment in the afternoon and I did not know if it would keep me from being able to get to sleep. No problem with getting to sleep. There is a bit of a tingle after using the product, but it does not last very long. The liquid is faintly grape flavored, not overly sweet or syrupy at all. The second day I took 7 drops in the morning ( 6:30 am) and 7 drops at 12:30 pm. NO afternoon crash! NO afternoon caffeine was needed either. I usually have to have a caffeinated beverage with a light lunch to ward off the afternoon "slump". This  Sublingual Vitamin B12 liquid absolutely works. I am less fatigued and I have more energy. I do not take it twice a day on the weekend, only once in the mornings on Saturdays and Sundays. But, my job requires intense focus and attention to detail so I use it twice a day on work days. I will be reordering this product. Thank you Amazon for offering such quality products such as this one.

body: Okay, idk how effective it normally works for most people but it seemed to have worked pretty fast for me. Either the very next day or two days after i took it, i got an urge to go workout after taking a hiatus for a few months, so im guessing it gave me the energy that i needed. I went to the doctor to get a blood test and she perscripted me vitamin b12 (cyan, of course), and i knew i just wasn't gonna take the kind she wrote up for me to pick up at Walgreens around the corner from me. I started taking two servings a day (one at day and one at night) for close to a week before i got a headache and i figure it was from taking too much, so i switched back to one. I haven't been as drowsy since taking it, with the vitamin D i bought. I also was suffering from bleeding gums almost every time i brushed my teeth, and i found out bleeding gums are a side effect of b12 deficiency after i started taking it, so that made me convinced it works! Unfortunately, im only giving it a 4 and not a 5 because the amount of ppl saying Live Wise shorted them of the expected servings. I tried to keep track but was derailed after i clumsily spilled a quarter of the bottle on my computer desk. (SMH) It works, though. Next time i buy it, i'll keep close count to the servings though. But if you're looking for efficiency, it definitely works and i'd recommend it over anything the doctor writes up! (And no, this isn't a fake or paid review.)

body: I wanted to wait until I used an entire bottle before I left a review.  I followed their written directions- they suggest taking 15 drops and hold it under the tongue for 90 seconds.  Then swish for 30 seconds before you swallow.  It sounds complicated but it really is easy.  You would need to wait for 10 minutes before you eat.  The liquid is red and you end up counting as the liquid drops from the dropper so I suggest standing in front of a mirror.  I was initially drawn to this particular brand since there are only three ingredients: purified water, organic grape alcohol and Vitamin B12.  Listed on the box are three different dosages.  5 drops = 1000mcg.  15 drops - 3000mcg.  30 drops = 6000mcg.  Now the reason why I gave it only two stars.  It didn't matter if I used 5 drops or 15 drops or 30 drops, I felt the same--I didn't feel anything different--No increased energy--nothing.  How disappointing especially when I needed it this morning when I left very early to drive three hours and I felt tired.  I thought I should have felt a little more energy since I took the largest dosage.  Maybe you might have better luck if you purchase this product.
title: Easy to take but didn't give me energy

body: These b12 drops worked great!  My doctor suggested a b12 supplement after my lab showed my level was low at 286.  I used about 7 drops undr my tongue twice per day.  I held it in my mouth for a minute or two and didn't drink anything for 15 minutes.  I recently had my levels rechecked after 3 months and my b12 was at 884.  I have more energy and feel healthier overall.  I would definitely give these a try especially before resorting to b12 injections.

First I don't think it's working for me. Second the taste is horrible. My other b12 had to be refrigerated after opening...this one does not. I don't know but I just don't seem to getting the benefits from this brand. Plus what is up with the holding under the tongue for 90 seconds...then swishing around...then finally swallowing. But then don't eat for 10 minutes. Really!?!!!!! I really did want this brand to work for me. I'm now going to try the brand from Global Health.
title: Swish...not a slam dunk

body: Taste fine. Not sweetened but is still kind of like a mild cough syrup...but more alcoholic. Some kids won't love it slightly burning under their tongue, but all adults should be fine. My son gets a tiny drop and says he doesn't care for the sensation but he gets through it. I'll keep buying this one.
title: It works.

body: Seemed to work well as far as having more energy. Unfortunately, my mouth became very dry and cottony feeling after use. I stopped and then restarted and the same thing happened. Maybe the alcohol in it?

body: I just got this yesterday but already noticed a a difference with the first dose. So easily absorbed. I am starting with only 5 drops and that maybe all I need each day.Made in USA and Methylcobalamin form of B 12. I also purchased the D3 K2 from this same company and took that this morning. Both tastes good tastes The D3 k2 having a peppermint that is not overwhelming peppermint, but just right for for my taste. I hope this company can begin to make more pure and sublingual Vitamins with the same purity of no hidden fillers,  allergen, GMO's & etc. as too many companies are slacking on keeping their product pure, even those that used to be good companies.. I had a question and called the number and got a return call the same day. So very good customer satisfaction and very personable. They are working on certifications for organic and 3rd party verification so I was told. This looks to be a good product that I will be ordering from and I already purchased another bottle of their  b 12 from them for my daughter. I DID NOT get any discount or free product for this review.
title: Good B-12 product with pure ingredients, easily absorbed sublingual Made In USA

body: I can't really say much about this product.  Some people report increased energy, but I don't notice anything.  I will say I don't notice anything with lozenges that I've used in the past either.  The taste was tolerable.  It probably helped to increase my B-12 levels but I can't say for sure as I did not have blood work performed after trying it.  If lozenges provide enough B-12 I would rather use those.  I just didn't like using the dropper and trying to hold liquid under my tongue.
title: Taste ok but not a fan of liquid form

body: My doctor found I was deficient in B12 and I was prescribed the shots.  I hated giving them to myself.  When I learned about these drops I knew I had to try them.  The taste isn't great (as to be expected) but would rather do that than the shots.  My doc had said supplements typically weren't absorbed well but after some research these type of drops were actual found to absorb equal to the shots and much easier to bear.  My levels have improved as have my energy levels.  If you are in need of B12 supplements this is a great option.
title: Better than the shots

body: Have only taken for a few days and dont notice a "surge" of energy just yet but I did notice I was not wanting to crawl into bed and crash at 3pm as usual, or at any point before my actual bedtime for that matter. I also felt a bit more clear-minded than usual. I would like to say that the flavour is great. Was worried because of the reviews but this stuff barely has any flavor. And if you use more than is recommended or put on the tongue instead of under as instructed, which is the only reason you would really taste the grape alcohol, the flavor is not bad by any means. Slightly grapey, slightly like vodka, still not much flavor. This stuff is great.
title: Really like it so far

body: Sublingual liquid Vitamin B12 is as effective as the Vitamin B12 injections. Before I started taking this liquid B12 I was fatigued, ached all over, had tremors and an alteration in taste (everything tasted either bitter or metallic). Within a week I noticed an improvement. body: Given its moderate cost this is a nice B12 supplement. Tastes like artificial berry flavor with a slightly medicinal (vitamin like) after-taste. The dark red color will stain clothing if you accidentally drip it on your clothes. So use it carefully. I have noticed some improvement in my energy levels since I started using this product. Nothing outstanding as some reviewers have reported. This brand uses the synthetically derived cyanocobalamin form of B12, which is then converted to methylcobalamin form of B12 by your body. The methyl form does not have to be converted and is readily available for your body to use. I plan to buy bottle of the methylcobalamin type to try to see if I react any differently to it.

body: My grandson was gravely vaccine-injured at 18mos from the MMR vaccine. What I didn't know about vaccines the, I do now. I had never heard about the MTHFR genetic mutation, or that it is a very high risk factor for vaccine injuries and death (in the 90 percentiles from my studies). It took us 5 1/2 years to get the CORRECT MEDICAL diagnoses that caused my grandson's anaphylaxis, encephalitis, and, yes, Measles, from the vaccine. We have an incredible Pediatric Neurologist, MD with Phoenix Children's Hospital that prescribes THIS PRODUCT for her vaccine injured, MTHFR kids. He also needed their 5-HTP for sleep, and Curcurmin to decrease inflammation. (among several other naturopathic products that he is now taking, and recovering from the pathophysiologies that caused his Autism Spectrum Disorder) The products by Seeking Health are second to none, and I highly recommend any product they sell for quality, naturopathic, scientifically tested, safe supplements and nutrients. WE ARE SO GRATEFUL! Well packaged. Shipped and received promptly. Our now 7 yr old "picky eater" sensitive to different tastes, has no problem letting this sublingual melt do its job. "It tastes O.K." he says. 10 stars - the taste passed the test!
title: "It tastes O.K." says 7 yr old Grandson with ASD and MTHFR Genetic Mutation: SO GRATEFUL FOR THIS PRODUCT!

body: Last October I started experiencing a buzzing feeling and tingling in my groin area, feet, and sometimes in my hands.  I was tested and was told after a spinal and brain MRI that I had a bulging disc and my neurologist told me that the bulging disc was causing the majority of my symptoms. I knew that the leg/groin buzzing could have possibly been sciatica from the bulging disc, but I didn't trust wholly that that was the root of the problem since I knew my upper extremities were involved as well.  I was tested for b12 and folate deficiency but was told my levels were fine.  After doing the physical therapy for the bulging disc, I still hadn't experienced any relief, and in fact, felt worse.  I also felt like my anxiety was making me crazy and I started to feel almost on edge since I was living daily with this strange sensation.  I read more and more about deficiency and I felt like I had nothing to lose by supplementing since nothing else had helped at all.
title: Great for nerves and mental health, especially postpartum

body: I started taking this about 3 months ago after learning that I am homozygous for the MTHFR a1298C. For the past 7-8 years leading up to menopause (starting around age 40) I have had a steady decline of once-vibrant health and excellent fitness. I have always been athletic and fit with a lot of muscle tone but lost a lot of my fitness level and have been unable to maintain or even regain no matter how hard I tried. Anyhow, a couple things I've noticed since starting this product.
title: Totally a believer!

body: I have hypothyroidism and struggle with low energy levels. Someone mentioned that this supplement might help increase my energy, so I thought I would give it a try. I have been really impressed! I have been taking them for several weeks now, and I have definitely noticed an increase in energy. I was worried about having the chew them up, but I really don't mind the taste. I will be adding these to my daily routine!
title: Boosted my energy levels

body: I just stumbled upon the MTHFR mutation and it describes me to no end: Panic attacks, depression, misscarriages, tongue tied babies, heart valve issues... I was taking Folic acid and other synthetic vitamins and was noticing a spike in panic attacks and depression episodes and many other signs of this mutation. I finally started researching and came across it. I got off all folic acid and immediately ordered this product. I have to say it has been working well for me. My panic attacks have completely stopped and my mind lost its foggyness. I feel more awake in the mornings and I have been feeling like myself again. I've been taking it for 3 weeks now. I've increased to a pill and a half a day. The pills themselves are delicious! They taste like candy! I love the taste! I let it desolve under my tongue. I've also started taking Krill oil and iron in vegetable form. I have also felt more motivated and have even started working out!? What!? Anyway. I believe my body was severely lacking in folate and vitamin B and I was poisoning it with folic acid for so many years! I do have a problem gaining weight (I have always been underweight) and I'm working on figuring that out but for now I'm happy with these pills and hope to take the blood test soon to see what will further work for me.
title: They are helping!

body: Taste is not obnoxious, the pills dissolve easily, and I've had a noticeable increase in energy and focus over the last several weeks and -- unexpectedly -- a decrease in my chronic headaches. I am satisfied and will keep buying it; I even recently gave a bottle to my mother after she complained of low energy and focus.

body: I am 69 years old, and my health problems are far too many to go into here. I literally could write a book. However, I went to a new clinic last year to try and get some help. About the only thing that they did that was positive for me was to test me for the MRHFR. I did test positive and not only from my father, but from my mother, too. However, their recommendation of one methylated B vitamin a day hardly helped. Instinctively, I knew that with my low energy, I needed more B-12. I searched and searched until I found this product. I had heard that the only way you could take too much B-12 was to fill your bathtub full of it and drown yourself in it. So I began to take more than one per day. I was actually noticing a slight difference in my body. I decided that I would go back to this product on Amazon and read the reviews. I ordered it initially not on the reviews, but on the fact of the ingredients. One of my favorite things to do is read the reviews. You can learn so much from the people that order and their reviews. From this I learned of Dr. Ben Lynch's website, the originator of these supplements. I began to search his website, and found more supplements for MTHFR. I am taking one Homocystex Plus after breakfast and one Optimal Sleep. One of the results is that I am no longer waking up at night with a terrile case of hives.That is huge for me. My wonderful husband would wake up and rub my skin for about 15 minutes til they went away. If they lasted much longer, they would be unbearable. I have just started taking the Optimal Amino Blend, but my main goal now is to find a doctor in my area that will help me go forward.
title: One of my favorite things to do is read the reviews

body: I read so many excellent testimonials about B-12, and specifically about this brand.  The supposed benefits, including clearer mental function, more energy, and better sleep, were very compelling.  And guess what - they are all true!!! body: The manufacturer has asked me, twice, for a review of this product, so I'll oblige: first of all I am not an analytical chemist and don't have a lab, so I cannot even say whether this product contains what the label claims. It could be milk powder, for all I know. Second, assuming the claims are accurate, as I'm sure they are, the effects of any nutritional supplement are likely to be subtle and, in any case, impossible to distinguish from placebo effects in almost any individual case, absent a proper controlled trial. Even if my spouse, the product's end user, were to claim dramatic effects I could not honestly attribute them to it. I can, however, say that the pills arrived promptly and well packaged.

body: In the supplement world, I have had to kiss a lot of frogs to gain a few princes, so to speak.  Active B-12 is a proverbial "prince"  of supplements for me. Since starting this product about 5 weeks ago, I have had almost no "poor mood" days, meaning that I have been able to basically eliminate taking SAM-e, which I had used to treat an occasional poor mood.  I do not know what my MTHFR genetic status is, (I plan to take the $99 "23andme" test soon) but I'd wager that I have one of these MTHFR genetic variants, since the Active B-12 seems to work so well for me. Since the Active B is required by the body at the beginning of the methylation cycle, I now no longer seem to need the SAMe, which is one of the end products of the methylation cycle. Active B12 is also cheaper than exorbitantly priced SAMe.  The combination of this product-- together with my elimination of Aspartame and Glyphosate (Roundup) drenched Wheat products--- has almost completely restored my mental wellbeing!! (I can still have a little bit of organic King Arthur flour with no problems, but I generally stay away from glyphosate poisoned wheat-- and almost all wheat in America is sprayed with Roundup before harvest to prompt seed production and evenness of ripening.) body: I cannot swallow large pills, but most of the methylated B12 vitamins are either large capsules or hard-to-swallow tablets. I get tired of pulverizing tablets or emptying contents of capsules into my smoothies or other foods! So, these pleasant-tasting lozenges are a Godsend for me. I believe that some of the leading capsules contain larger doses of the methylated B12, so on that note, perhaps these are a bit pricey. But, time will tell. If this product is purer, which I believe that it is b/c there are no other "fillers", then less is probably more. I am satisfied, therefore I will order this product again.
title: I am satisfied, therefore I will order this product again

body: This is my favorite B-12+folate supplement. I hate swallowing pills, and this one is very tiny and chewable.  It is so small that you could actually swallow it instead if you prefer.  You can barely taste it, but the cherry flavor you do taste is very pleasant and not to sweet or tart.  I love that it has real folate and not folic acid, which is important especially if you have the mthfr genetic mutation.

body: Surprisingly small in size, though they take some time to dissolve if placed under the tongue. body: It did not work at all.  After the fact I looked to see if it was USP, and it is not.  There is wider variability in non-USP, non-standardized supplements, so you could be getting almost nothing.  I wonder if this is the case.  When you buy a supplement you don't know if it will actually have the amount in it that is listed.  When the supplement does not work, you have to consider that, with wide variability in actual amounts of the active ingredient, you may have gotten too low a dose to have any effect.  I don't know, but I think it is a possibility, since this was ineffective.

The difference between taking the active form of folate and B12 versus regular vitamins is night and day.  I strongly suggest not self-diagnosing though.  You do not want to alter the biochemical processes in your body unnecessarily.  If your body cannot process folic acid found in food and vitamins, this is the product for you.  Absolutely a huge difference in my life.  I am so happy with it!!

body: I purchased this from Amazon on 7/20 and received it on 7/22. I have been taking this product since March and originally ordered it from the manufacturer. Previously I thought this worked very well and it seemed to be clearing up a couple of health problems. However, the bottle I bought in July made things worse. By the end of August I honestly thought I had MS and serious memory problems. I know I need a high dose of methylcobalamin due to my genetics, so my husband convinced me to buy another brand locally. Within two weeks, my numbness and tingling is fading and my memory is getting better. I just looked at the old bottle of Seeking Health's product and discovered there was a sticker on the bottom with "2/16" on it. I peeled off the sticker and see it says, "MFG 02/2014" and "044C14." I think this is a bad lot. (I kept the bottle in a dark cabinet away from heat and light.) Generally, I think Seeking Health has good products and their website is very helpful, but I think the shelf life and stability of their products is not as good as they think. If one of their products stops working for you, let them know.
title: Bad Lot Does More Harm Than Good

body: The manufacturer has asked me, twice, for a review of this product, so I'll oblige: first of all I am not an analytical chemist and don't have a lab, so I cannot even say whether this product contains what the label claims. It could be milk powder, for all I know. Second, assuming the claims are accurate, as I'm sure they are, the effects of any nutritional supplement are likely to be subtle and, in any case, impossible to distinguish from placebo effects in almost any individual case, absent a proper controlled trial. Even if my spouse, the product's end user, were to claim dramatic effects I could not honestly attribute them to it. I can, however, say that the pills arrived promptly and well packaged.

If this is visible, I can only imagine what is developing inside the sprayer or bottle and not visible. If I bought this again I would keep it in the fridge. I live in Michigan for goodness sake, not exactly a tropical climate. This is dangerous, please be cautious when using this product.

body: I'm a fan of Garden of Life products... But when I order this B-12 spray, about half of the time I get a bottle that has leaked out and soaked into the cellophane and box. Usually it doesn't bother me, but this last time there was a noticeable degradation in taste. Now, Methylcobalamin is an unstable molecule. Great care needs to be taken to ensure that the product does not come into contact with heat or light. But obviously, the current packaging is not able to achieve a barrier. I wouldn't be surprised if the B-12 molecules in many of these bottles are destroyed. GOL, great product otherwise -- but please consider looking into your quality control for this product line.
title: Good product -- Bad quality control

body: I use this daily as Dr. said my B12 was low. Now when I'm tested comes out normal. Spritz in your mouth daily, that simple. I spritz twice or thrice even though it says once is good. Works well for me as before using I was losing hair on my head and the doctor told me my low B12 and D3 levels was the problem. I like this brand because it's organic and it's absorbed faster because it's liquid. Also B12 in olive oil is more easily absorbed from what I've read. I've been using for over 2 years now and recently after losing blood - my levels still stayed high and I think it's because of the high quality brand that I keep my levels so high. My doctor is really happy too because before my blood levels were always low. I was even hospitalized for blood loss and the medical staff was so surprised that all of my blood levels stayed high in spite of losing large amounts of blood.

body: The taste of this liquid is great, and is easy to use - I actually WANT to take it in the morning and hate missing it. Anecdotally I've noticed an increase in energy since taking it, but I can't guarantee that that's not a fluke or due to something else (I do think this helps though). One caveat: after spraying, some of the product drips out of a little bit out at the end, so there's always some of the liquid that runs down the spray part and the cap when you put it back on. I purchased the D3 spray too, both straight from Amazon, and they both have this issue, so I don't think it's an issue with just mine (I'm curious if anyone else has this issue?). title: Great product, slightly flawed design

body: It's so simple to take my B-12 now! My last bloodwork put me at the very low end of the normal range of vitamin B-12, in the category where you might see some negative effects from inadequate B-12, so my doctor recommended I up my intake. The problem wasn't that I didn't have any B-12 supplements, but that I wasn't using them regularly. I had sublingual tablets that take a while to dissolve, and I didn't take them routinely because either I didn't think about it or because it was not convenient at the time to wait for it to dissolve. This spray solves that problem. I just keep the bottle beside my computer and put a spray under my tongue once per day, sometimes twice if I feel like I might need some extra energy. The taste is pleasant too.
title: Quick and easy B-12!

body: Being anemic and having health issues, I need to take a B12 supplement.  So, I went to search high and low for a spray or oral B12 to add to my daily regiment. It has a strong rapberry flavor that doesn't make it taste like a vitamin and is super quick and easy to administer.  Love that this is also on auto-ship so I know I won't have to remember to re-order everytime.  Very pleased with this in all aspects.

body: I've been using this for a couple months now, and just got a second bottle because I'm definitely sticking with it.  We'd looked into several options for methyl B-12, since I have one copy of the MTHFR gene and my body doesn't handle the conversion from regular cyanocobolmin into methylcobolmin.  Since I have a corn intolerance too, our options were limited, but when we found this it answered all of our needs.  A spray, particularly when sprayed under the tongue, has better absorption in most cases than a pill anyways, and this tastes great and is easy to take.  It doesn't seem to have anything that's added that isn't important, which is a nice bonus.  It's always tough to evaluate the effectiveness without blood tests to confirm my B-12 levels, which I'll get fairly soon, but I can feel the energy boost and notice when I haven't taken it in too long as well.  Definitely a great choice if you have one or two copies of the MTHFR gene, and really a good choice even if you don't but just want a good B-12 supplement that you know will be absorbed well.

body: Which is GREAT news... Usually, seeing any kind of "Natural Flavor" puts up red flags for MSG and aspartame, to name a few nasty not-so-natural chemicals that enhance the flavor of many processed foods and supplements. I asked the company and they say the ingredients of that particular listing is from natural and organice fruit juice and fruit, period. This is great news, because it's been so hard to find a B12 supplement that didn't have a sneaky ingredient like "Natural Flavor' (see the "Truth in Labeling website, for all the different ways manufacturers hide excitotoxins in our foods and supplements!). The Organic designation gives me further confidence that this is true. Way to go, Garden of Life!!! I finally have a product to recommend to my friends and family that I can trust. Thank you...

body: Which is GREAT news... Usually, seeing any kind of "Natural Flavor" puts up red flags for MSG and aspartame, to name a few nasty not-so-natural chemicals that enhance the flavor of many processed foods and supplements. I asked the company and they say the ingredients of that particular listing is from natural and organice fruit juice and fruit, period. This is great news, because it's been so hard to find a B12 supplement that didn't have a sneaky ingredient like "Natural Flavor' (see the "Truth in Labeling website, for all the different ways manufacturers hide excitotoxins in our foods and supplements!). The Organic designation gives me further confidence that this is true. Way to go, Garden of Life!!! I finally have a product to recommend to my friends and family that I can trust. Thank you...

body: The bottle had leaked during shipping, so it was sticky and I was nervous to even use it since I didn't know if it had been tampered with or if it was still safe to use. No since in using vitamins if it could possibly make me sick. I thought "what the heck" and tried one spray; seriously gross. I think its supposed to be raspberry but the only thing I could taste was cherry cough syrup. Why anyone would prefer this over a simple sub-lingual tablet is  beyond me. Not only did I immediately throw it out because it was leaking but the taste was awful anyways and now Im back to using sub-lingual form which I have always used.

body: I have Pernicious Anemia.  Diagnosed back in 1989, at first I was getting B-12 shots every month.  After a couple of years the doctors said that new studies showed that I could probably get enough B-12 by mouth if I took pills, 5 grams, per day and would not give me shots unless this didn't work.  It actually worked better then the shots.  As time went on my legs and feet began to hurt to a point that made it very difficult to walk.  Doctors blamed it on Diabetes ( very low amount) I suspected something else.
title: It actually worked better then the shots

body: My pudendal nerve was injured by a slip and fall.  I would not accept the shots or surgery for a chance at repairing it.  I opted instead to live with it.  I mentioned this problem in a drug store, a small chain in Nor California, and the floor manager recommended I take 5000mcg of B 12 per day.  I knew the B family is food for the nervous system and I purchased the brand I trusted and began this regimen.  My pudendal nerve has been fine if I do this B 12 amount each day.  I have run out and forgot to buy more and my pudendal reverted back in no time.  I found this at Amazon and I trust Kirkland, bought this and have not been disappointed!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  I highly recommend it.
title: Put the Pudendal injury in the past...

body: I paid much less for these tablets online than I would have paid in my local Target. The tablets work! I began taking them, because I had restless leg syndrome. My doctor said it was probably a result of a low vitamin B12 level. A blood test confirmed his suspicion. He prescribed vitamin B12 injections, but after the first injection, I suffered insomnia for a week. So, the doctor suggested tablets, adding that he didn't think they would work. His argument was that if my gut wasn't absorbing B12 from food, it probably wouldn't absorb it from tablets, either. When I mentioned sub-lingual B12 tablets, he expressed his doubts.
title: Economical, and they worked!

body: Take these once a day, they are the right kind of B12 and the 5000mcg is what is recommend for people with low B12 or an immune disorder.  Highly recommend and due to the fact that I have to take B12 possibly for the rest of my life I will continue buying.  Thanks Kirkland Signature, you never fail to amaze me with a low priced and great quality product.  I can no longer afford to shop at Costco but I can afford to buy your products off Amazon.

Your nerves ...everything calms down immediately.  If you have peaks and lows...buy don't buy..eat don't eat...drink don't drink....Get a little more control by making sure you have B vitamins and make sure this one is present for sure. These are so easy to take...I wish the sweetner wasn't Sucralose....such a great product..maybe they will change this.  I am a return customer...I love how it works.
title: So easy this way...

body: Suffering with a severe Vitamin B12 deficiency (diagnosed by a neurologist) he suggested three intramuscular injections followed by a daily dose of 5000 mcg of Vit B12. He told me that the ONLY way for the body to absorb the vitamin via a supplement was to take it sublingually (under the tongue). He was correct and I haven't been plagued with the symptoms of the deficiency since I started taking these pills. I have my level checked by a blood test every three months and it's always good. A major cause of senile dementia and confusion is a vitamin B12 deficiency. This replacement supplement has helped my cognitive abilities, memory, insomnia, and muscle twitching. It dissolves quickly in your mouth and tastes good. It does stain your mouth cherry red but it washes away after a drink of water. I'll never go without it again.
title: I have my level checked by a blood test every three months and it's always good. A major cause of senile dementia and confusion

body: I waited a few months before reviewing to see what the actual results were from taking these B-12 supplements.  I can now say, from personal experience, that they do indeed work, and work well. The reason that I ordered them in the first place was that my Dr. ordered labs said that my B-12 level was low.  My Dr. indicated that I might need to begin taking B-12 shots.  Within a couple of days of hearing this I ordered this product. (Kirkland Signature Sublingual B-12 5000 mcg, 300 Tablets) Upon receiving them I took 1 per day for nearly three months, when I had labs done again.  My new levels showed >2000.  The normal range showing on my lab report is said to be 200-1100.  I haven’t had a chance to ask my Dr. if being to high is a problem, but the lab report did not indicate that this was an issue.  I have cut back to 1 every other day though just to be sure.
title: The pills themselves taste great and I have no problem dissolving them under my ...

body: If you need energy you need this daily! Pop one under your tongue for 30 seconds and swallow the rest and you're done. This is a great pick-me-up all day long and I don't feel like a need a nap during the day to keep going. If I stop taking it, man can I feel it. Good flavor for me, it's not for everyone (my wife doesn't like it). I've done B12 drops as well and this is much easier, cheaper, and no mess. No brainer for me!

body: I am a 55 year old femal who bought this product to stave off memory loss. not sure if it will help with that long term, but my 75-year old mother has Althzeimers (onset 4 or 5 years ago) and they put her on vitamin B injections to help prevent future memory loss.  My sisters and I used to joke about our bad memories being just like Moms. We aren't laughing anymore.  We did some reading, this formulation is better absorbed and used by the body than the typical less expensive B12 supplement, and of course I can't remember the key word to look for now, - how ironic is that?!  ( I could go look it up, but I am very stubborn.... it will come to me, eventually........)  Not sure if I am impressed by 'sublingual' delivery, but the cherry flavor isn't over whelming, nor is it bitter, and they taste and dissolve just fine.  I take 3 a day.  4 made my hot flashes come back.  As a bonus, I do believe the energy level claims are working for me.  Bottom line, they are worth a try for either memory improvement or energy production.  Works for me (for the most part :-) ), could work for you too!
title: good value, good product

body: I was diagnosed over 30 years ago in my early 30s as BPII, onset at 13. Since my diagnosis happened early on - when the term bipolar began to supplant manic depression - I was put on every drug on formulary and off in an effort to control it. Always on lithium. Since retiring early and being well into menopause I have found I can do without the drugs as long as I keep my life calm which was not possible when I was working with multiple crucial (to someone!) deadlines per day. I read taking B's has shown to be effective in controlling the disorder but there are no definitive clinical trials demonstrating this to be true. Nonetheless, I can state that, for me, taking B12 (15000 mcg) has proved to be a godsend. When I first started taking it I would often forget to use it for several days and I really felt the difference. Now I keep it on my mood chart to remind me. Again, this is anecdotal, not clinical, but it has helped me enormously.
title: Helps with BPII

body: I am B-12 deficient, so when choosing a B-12 supplement, I want something that packs a punch. This formula is has 5000 mcg of potency. That is the largest dosage I have found thus far. Even the injectible B-12 shots are only 1000 mcg! My doctor told me it could be a couple of months before I noticed a significant difference because of how low my levels are. I am currently taking one in the morning and one in the evening. They are easy to swallow capsules and don't upset my stomach. I look forward to finally feeling normal again! body: One asks oneself why do companies put so much stuff into products...stuff that is not the main item one seeks to purchase. This product Kirkland Sublingual B-12 is a prime example. I wanted to buy vitamin B-12 with methylcobalamin. I did not read the additional contents listed and I went ahead and ordered it anyway. BIG MISTAKE. Each tiny tablet of this product has a lot more than 5000 mcg of B-12. It unfortunately also contains mannitol, microcrystalline cellulose, crospovidone, stearic acid, methycoblamin, silicon dioxide, natural cherry flavor, red beet root, sucralose, manesium stearate. Label also casually adds: "May contain citric acid, gum arabic, maltodextrin, triacetin". Hmm, does it or doesn't it? Makes you wonder about this company's quality control.
title: Vitamin B-12 and a whole lot more unfortunately

body: One asks oneself why do companies put so much stuff into products...stuff that is not the main item one seeks to purchase. This product Kirkland Sublingual B-12 is a prime example. I wanted to buy vitamin B-12 with methylcobalamin. I did not read the additional contents listed and I went ahead and ordered it anyway. BIG MISTAKE. Each tiny tablet of this product has a lot more than 5000 mcg of B-12. It unfortunately also contains mannitol, microcrystalline cellulose, crospovidone, stearic acid, methycoblamin, silicon dioxide, natural cherry flavor, red beet root, sucralose, manesium stearate. Label also casually adds: "May contain citric acid, gum arabic, maltodextrin, triacetin". Hmm, does it or doesn't it? Makes you wonder about this company's quality control.
title: Vitamin B-12 and a whole lot more unfortunately

body: We have been adding a few supplements to my son's diet to try to help his focusing/verbal ability. He is 4 years old and has high functioning autism with a verbal delay.  We have been adding one thing at a time. He had been on vitamin D drops for about 6 months and we decided to add this as well.  As soon as we did, he and his sister (also autistic, more on the Asperger side) started having side effects. I looked up the side effects parents were experiencing with b12 shots and they were the same as we were having.  My son was putting things in his mouth constantly, was very distracted/hyper, regressed verbally back into script speech.  We only had a few months left on our ABA scholarship so decided to stop using it and retry after a few months since it says the side effects should go away within 3-6 months.  Its been two weeks and my son STILL is not back to his usual self.  Hand flapping is out of control where as before he hardly EVER hand flapped.  His attention is horrendous, worse than its ever been.  I really caution anyone thinking of using this to treat autism to do so under the guidance of a doctor and with extreme caution.  I worry that this may be a permanent set back to him. Will update when/if his regression ends.
title: If buying for autistic child BEWARE

body: Cyanocobalamin is the most famous and widely produced vitamer in the vitamin B12 family. Cyanocobalamin is Vitamin b12 with cyanide. The amount of cyanide used in b12 shouldn't have any negative effects to anyone. I disagree, because I felt more tired and had headaches after taking this supplement for 2 weeks. I found out about b12 vitamin forms and after 3 days of switching to a different b12 (( methylcobalamin b12 )), My energy went up and my tiredness and headaches vanished.
title: Cyanocobalamin  vs Methylcobalamin

body: Vitamin B12 is sometimes called "the energy vitamin". B12 supplements are a must for everyone on a plant based diet, people with Celiac or Chrohn's Disease, persons who have had part of the stomach or small intestine removed, someone with Pernicious Anemia, heavy drinkers and smokers, pregnant and breast-feeding women, persons with bacterial growth in the intestine or parasites, people on certain medications that inhibit B12, as well as anyone over the age of 50.
title: Got energy?

body: This is an excellent product, both in its obvious and not-so-obvious attributes.  First, the form of B12 in Deva's formula is methylcobalamin, which is the only form that is readily absorbed by us in oral form.  Second, the formula also contains Folic Acid and B6, which act synergetically with B12 to optimize utilization.  Third, this is one of the few purveyors of B12 that guarantee they do not use genetically modified sources.  And finally, the sublingual tablets help to insure maximum absorption by the system.  And the price is right.  This is the best source of B12 I have found.
title: The best B-12

body: I was having horrible difficulties with fatigue that the doctors couldn't figure out... then the taste buds started disappearing on my tongue and they figured out that I was deficient in B-12. My score was only 107 ... it's no wonder that I had no energy!
title: If you take medicine for heartburn, you need THIS product. Not all B-12 are the same!

body: Due to my vegan diet and me just being this way, I had a B12 deficiency (which I just found out about). So of course, I was on the hunt for some vegan vitamins. I'm glad I found these. I'm already feeling more energy. I use to wake up and be tired, even if I slept for 10 hours or more. And normally by hour 4 of being awake, I wanted to crash.
title: I'm already feeling it!

body: LOVE these, I wish all sublingual dissolved this quick, it's awesome! The taste is good and love that it's safe and vegan, even though I'm only a vegetarian it's nice not having to worry when I see something is vegan I know I'm good.  Most people won't know if a vitamin is really working but my husband and I both have felt much better after taking these, his depression has decreased and his psoriasis/dandruff has lessened and we have more energy.  Highly recommend and love these, so glad we found them!

body: We've been using these for quite a while now.  They dissolve quickly under your tongue. and have a pleasant citrus taste.
